prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

here are first few lines of the file(s).

Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx:
Genes	CASE_1	CASE_2	CASE_3	CASE_4	CASE_5	CASE_6	CTRL_1	CTRL_2	CTRL_3	CTRL_4	CTRL_5	CTRL_6
TSPAN6	9832	25521	23529	0	32	0	10558	20573	6507	0	0	 0
TNMD	3281	 7167	 3435	0	 0	0	  202	  403	 203	0	0	21


SRP021193.colData.tsv:
diagnosis	group	LibrarySelection
CASE_1	non-ischemic cardiomyopathy	CASE	cDNA


response:
```
# Load necessary libraries
library(readxl)
library(dplyr)
library(stats)
library(ggplot2)

# Read count table
count_data <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx", sheet = 1, col_names = TRUE)

# Read annotation data
annotation_data <- read.table("SRP021193.colData.tsv", header = TRUE, sep = "\t")

# Remove unnecessary columns from annotation data
annotation_data <- annotation_data %>% select(diagnosis, group)

# Transpose count data to have samples as rows and genes as columns
count_data <- t(count_data)

# Set row names as gene names from the count data
row.names(count_data) <- count_data[,1]

# Remove gene names column from count data
count_data <- count_data[,-1]

# Convert count data to matrix
count_data <- as.matrix(count_data)

# Join count data with annotation data based on sample ids
data <- left_join(as.data.frame(count_data), annotation_data, by = c("row.names" = "diagnosis"))

# Identify groups in annotation data
groups <- unique(data$group)

# Perform statistical test for each group
group_specific_genes <- list()
for (group in groups) {
  # Subset data for the specific group
  group_data <- data %>% filter(group == group)

  # Remove group column from group_data
  group_data <- group_data %>% select(-group)

  # Perform statistical test (you can choose appropriate test based on your data)
  p_values <- apply(group_data, 2, function(x) t.test(x ~ 1)$p.value)

  # Select genes with significant p-values (you can choose appropriate threshold)
  specific_genes <- names(p_values[p_values < 0.05])

  # Store group specific genes
  group_specific_genes[[group]] <- specific_genes
}

# Extract group specific genes from count data
group_specific_count_data <- count_data[, colnames(count_data) %in% unlist(group_specific_genes)]

# Perform PCA using group specific count data
pca <- prcomp(group_specific_count_data)

# Plot PCA with color-coded groups
ggplot(data.frame(pca$x), aes(x = PC1, y = PC2, color = factor(data$group))) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(color = "Group")
```
Note: I have made changes to the code to address the error. Specifically, I added `as.data.frame()` when joining the count data with the annotation data to ensure the "row.names" column is recognized.
